sentences.en: Blade Twisting: The delay on the daze effect has been reduced.
sentences.cn: 剑刃扭转? 在晕眩效果的延迟已经被降低.

sentences.en: For 35 minutes I was walking around in a daze.
He had been in a daze all the way to New York.
sentences.cn: 他去纽约途中一路恍惚.

sentences.en: He has been in a daze during the entire class.
sentences.cn: 他整堂课精神一直都很恍惚.

sentences.en: He stared ahead in a daze as if nothing around him existed.
sentences.cn: 他神色迷茫地望着前方,仿佛周围的一切都不存在了.

sentences.en: He was in a daze and could not understand what was happening.
sentences.cn: 他一直处在晕头转向之中,而且无法知道发生了什麽事.

sentences.en: I do not want anything, a daze, like you, all day.
sentences.cn: 我不想让任何事情, 发呆, 像你一样, 整天.

sentences.en: I reeled round in a daze.
I've been in a complete daze since hearing the sad news.
sentences.cn: 我听到那坏消息,一直全然不知所措.

sentences.en: Maggie's head was spinning in a daze of ultramarine blue far removed from Catholicism or Polynesia.
sentences.cn: 麦琪的思想远离天主教而沉入了让人眼花缭乱的深蓝色中.

sentences.en: Many evenings my mother would find me wandering in a daze and take me home.
sentences.cn: 多少个晚上,妈妈出来找我,见我愰愰惚惚流落街头,就把我领回家.

sentences.en: Mr. McKee awoke from his doze and started in a daze toward the door.
sentences.cn: 麦基先生打盹醒了,懵懵懂懂地朝门口走.

sentences.en: Old Cheng sat up in a daze.
sentences.cn: 老程迷迷忽忽的坐起来.

sentences.en: She wandered round in a daze, not quite sure what to do.
sentences.cn: 她恍恍惚惚地四处徘徊，不知该干什么。

sentences.en: She was in a daze and could not understand what was happening.
sentences.cn: 她很芒然,不明白发生了什么事.

sentences.en: The accident left him in a daze.
sentences.cn: 事故使他处于神志模糊的状态.

words.tran_cn: 头昏眼花地；恍惚地；眼花缭乱地
使眩晕；使惶惑（daze的过去式）

phrases.tran_cn: 在恍惚中；茫然；眼花缭乱；不知所措

trans.tran_en: feeling confused and not able to think clearly
